Garcia-Vidal, Carolina
metadata.dc:description: Invasive fungal infections remain a life-threatening disease. The development of invasive fungal disease is dependent on multiple factors, such us colonization and efficient host immune response. We aimed to review the pathogenesis of invasive fungal infections, in particular, those caused by Candida and Aspergillus. For this we propose, to describe the fungal characteristics, to detail the host defence mechanisms against fungus and to analyse the host risk factors for invasive fungal infection.
metadata.dc:title: Patogenia de la infección fúngica invasora.
[Pathogenesis of invasive fungal infections].
